page.title: 04The Smell 1
page.content: {Newspaper Extract-31.October 1975} For years jokers have been giving the best directions to get to Esholt- "just follow your nose"-for the name which means{ashwood}took on a less sweet meaning with the arrival of the sewage treatment complex completed in 1932.It became synonymous with odour, smell,pong,niff,whiff,and other,much more uncomplimentary remarks.Many words were less euphemistic and more vivid,depending on where you were standing,and which way the wind was blowing.On a foggy day the odour arising from Esholt Hall Estate,where Bradford's sewage treatment works were built,clings and hovers round. Way back in 1937,people living in Rawdon,Apperley Bridge,and as far away as Windhill,Idle and Thackley were locking their doors and windows and pegging up their noses.
